intro: Alsophila rufa, commonly known as the red-stemmed tree fern, is a species native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk covered with a reddish-brown, fibrous outer layer. The plant produces large, feathery fronds that can reach several meters in length, contributing to its dramatic appearance. Alsophila rufa is a slow-growing plant that thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it a notable species in tropical rainforests.
